definition: lit. see the wind and set your sails (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas
